subject: Gardening
title: The Garden of Eden in Art
description: Learn The Garden of Eden in Art in one minute.

hook.text: Every Western painter who depicted Eden created a garden that reflected their own era's ideal landscapeâ€”not the Bible's.

buildup.text: Medieval Edens showed enclosed gardens with local flowers. Renaissance versions added architecture and perspective.

discovery.text: Hieronymus Bosch's 'Garden of Earthly Delights' reimagined Eden as surreal and chaoticâ€”a garden of temptation.

twist.text: No two Edens look alike because 'paradise' is cultural. Each era's ideal garden becomes its version of paradise.

climax.text: Garden of Eden paintings reveal more about the artist's world than about any biblical description.

punchline.text: Every civilization paints paradise as its own best garden.

quiz.question: What do artistic depictions of the Garden of Eden reveal?
options: The precise location of the biblical garden
Each era's cultural ideal of paradise, not the biblical description
Universal agreement on what the perfect garden looks like
